content:
I keep getting the following error message when setting up mapping on the Feeds importer:
Notice: Undefined index: description in metatag_feeds_processor_targets_alter() (line 17 of /home/mhsmi001/draft/modules/metatag/metatag.feeds.inc)

It shows up 4 times every time I load the page. I'm not importing metatags, since we only use defaults so I'm ignoring it, but it's kind of annoying.
Hey @Elisabeth Garbeil :wave: ...thanks for taking the time to report this. Can you please raise an issue for it at https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/metatag/issues ?
I see that ~280 sites are using the Backdrop port, but the module has not been updated recently: https://backdropcms.org/project/usage/metatag

klonos said:

Hey Elisabeth Garbeil :wave: ...thanks for taking the time to report this. Can you please raise an issue for it at https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/metatag/issues ?

@klonos - Done. Issue is logged: https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/metatag/issues/53
@jenlampton do you have some time this week or weekend to have a sprint with me? ...we should at the very least look into getting it up to speed with the D7 module.
@Elisabeth Garbeil ++ thanks :pray:
garbeil** Cheers (Karma: 1)

Running into a big issue with Feeds importer - it is overwriting the Author and Post Date assigned in mapping and replacing with current logged in user and current date - this is a BIG issue for this client, since the announcements are sorted by date and the URL's are assigned by date - it's losing all that information on import. And there are a LOT of announcements - I can't fix them all manually. HELP!!!
Here's the field mappings. The URL, Title, Author and Date are critical: post-mapping.jpeg

I'll be attending drupalcamp colorado this weekend, but there's a sprint on
Sunday! That could be perfect :)
You're on! :smile:

Elisabeth Garbeil said:

Running into a big issue with Feeds importer - it is overwriting the Author and Post Date assigned in mapping and replacing with current logged in user and current date - this is a BIG issue for this client, since the announcements are sorted by date and the URL's are assigned by date - it's losing all that information on import. And there are a LOT of announcements - I can't fix them all manually. HELP!!!
Here's the field mappings. The URL, Title, Author and Date are critical: post-mapping.jpeg

I created issue " CRITICAL ISSUE - Feeds does not map created date, URL or author correctly, uses current date, current logged in user and creates URL instead #69". for this, and I need some kind of fix or workaround quickly if anyone can help. It's holding up the development at this point.

Elisabeth Garbeil said:

Running into a big issue with Feeds importer - it is overwriting the Author and Post Date assigned in mapping and replacing with current logged in user and current date - this is a BIG issue for this client, since the announcements are sorted by date and the URL's are assigned by date - it's losing all that information on import. And there are a LOT of announcements - I can't fix them all manually. HELP!!!
Here's the field mappings. The URL, Title, Author and Date are critical: post-mapping.jpeg

I created issue " CRITICAL ISSUE - Feeds does not map created date, URL or author correctly, uses current date, current logged in user and creates URL instead #69". for this, and I need some kind of fix or workaround quickly if anyone can help. It's holding up the development at this point.

The URL for the created issue is: https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/feeds/issues/69

Elisabeth
@Elisabeth Garbeil I'll have a look at that issue, I haven't had trouble with some of those mappings, so I'll compare my findings to yours.

@jenlampton, at this point, the biggest issue I’m having is the dates - the timezone feeds uses is GMT, not the timezone defined in Config-System. That means everything is off by 4 hours for this particular project. I’m looking into what format I have to use to force the timezone to be correct, but it shouldn’t be this big a deal.

Elisabeth Garbeil, MBA PMP
Brainwrap LLC
"Being on the web doesn't have to make your head hurt."
www.brainwrap.com
(810) 560-7181
egarbeil@brainwrap.com
Workaround for timezone issues: Use m-d-YTH:M:S[timezone offset] (ex. -4:00). for example 2020-05-22T10:51:50-4:00.

Anyone have luck using feeds to import an image field from a URL? I can output the URL of the image from views for the export, but mapping it to the IMAGE URI field in feeds import does not seem to trigger anything. I don't have time to mess with it, so I'll update the image fields manually for just the newest items.
I've been doing mukti-valued fields, which means custom PHP code that explodes the values then does a file_save thing...

BWPanda said:

I've been doing mukti-valued fields, which means custom PHP code that explodes the values then does a file_save thing...

You can use feeds tamper for that, which would save some custom coding, but I don't know how it would help with images, since I can pretty much only pull the URL via views (and csv export). I can't really use some other methods, because I need to pull full html bodies - more important than the images.
I have done images via URL in D7 but can't recall if I have done that yet in Backdrop. If you try and have a problem please file an issue.
Feeds Tamper had lots of issues when I tried it, to the point if not working, hence the custom code

BWPanda said:

Feeds Tamper had lots of issues when I tried it, to the point if not working, hence the custom code

@BWPanda good to know!
Not sure when you tried it but @Herb put a bunch of work in recently.

https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/feeds_tamper/issues/4

Cannot edit or delete tampers · Issue #4 · backdrop-contrib/feeds_tamper
When trying to edit or delete a tamper, I get an 'Access denied' error: You are not authorized to access this page.
@BWPanda I can't replicate that error you mention there

Hi @Elisabeth Garbeil , if you need any help with Feeds, I still have my feeds import set up from when I converted a D6 site to Backdrop earlier this year, including my import CSVs. For images I simply used the full url path from the old site. No issues with this, but there were some other fields that needed extra attention.

Stuart Brown said:

Hi Elisabeth Garbeil , if you need any help with Feeds, I still have my feeds import set up from when I converted a D6 site to Backdrop earlier this year, including my import CSVs. For images I simply used the full url path from the old site. No issues with this, but there were some other fields that needed extra attention.

@Stuart Brown, I was using the full image URL to import into the URI field for images, but it didn't work in feeds - was there something else you did as well? I've managed to work out everything else.
I just setup my first single image import (i.e. not multi-valued, and hence not using custom file_save() code), and it didn't work. Will try to debug...

Ok, fixed it. So here's the settings for the image field in the View export I have in D7: image.png
I was using the 'Absolute file path' URL type originally, and it didn't work. When I changed it to the 'Full URL' type, then it worked.
Those options are available because I installed the https://www.drupal.org/project/image_url_formatter module

BWPanda said:

Ok, fixed it. So here's the settings for the image field in the View export I have in D7: image.png
I was using the 'Absolute file path' URL type originally, and it didn't work. When I changed it to the 'Full URL' type, then it worked.

Excellent to know. I had just used URL path - did you map Full URL to Image URI in feeds?

did you map Full URL to Image URI in feeds?

Yep

I'm just guessing, but I assume the URL you give Feeds for an image/file needs to be one you can enter in your browser to download the file. I assume Feeds does that (downloads it), then 'uploads' it into the new field.
Presumably that's why nothing but the full, proper URL works...
